alert.note: Alert for Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 08 at 5:40PM EDT until August 08 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN PRINCE GEORGES COUNTY... At 540 PM EDT, rainfall has ended, but flash flooding continues within the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Prince Georges County Fire Department reported flooding in the Riverdale/Blandensburg area. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bowie... College Park... Greenbelt... Bladensburg... Landover... Hyattsville... Takoma Park... East Riverdale... Adelphi... New Carrollton... Mitchellville... Riverdale Park... Cheverly... Woodmore... Lanham-Seabrook... Greater Landover... Goddard... Chillum... Glenn Dale... Mount Rainier... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Basement flooding can occur quickly and create a life-threatening situation. If you are in a basement, or a residence below street level, move to a higher floor immediately.
